instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
Hi, I have  a 13 pro 2015 macbook that doesnt turn on
when i press the power button, the trackpad can click, but sometimes, it can be oversensitive with multiple click like a woodpecker
<CHIP>U4650</CHIP> looks dirty with flux
what should I measure first ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
Post voltages on the big coils (secondary power supplies).
Do you get VCORE?
If yes, test for USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message: i got 12.6 on all big coil, cpu does get warm, <CAPACITOR>C4691</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C4690</CAPACITOR> is missing, so I replaced it, <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C8080</CAPACITOR> is missing too, and i placed it, now when i turn it on, the trackpad can click normally, but still no display, i got a fan spin, and i can toggle the caps lock light on and off..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
[URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/11979-2015-<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-green-light-orange-light-no-boot-no-power[/URL]
from that link, I realize that my <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and the circuit is shorted to ground too, does it mean the cpu is alr deaD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
Wrong assumption!
You have correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, no short at all.
But is only one big coil there, L7130.
You probably got confused with big capacitors.

If trackpad clicks and CPU warms, probably all voltages are good, but I expected you post them.
And still wait to confirm USB activity.
Did you try external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
yeah i mistake the big capacitor with the coil, but the voltage is still 12.6v
is mouse light count as usb activity ? because it light on the mouse
havent try external video, i assume there's would not be a display because i don here a chime?
i will post all the voltage in a moment

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 12.6v
pp3v42 : 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> : 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> : 5.18v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> : 5.18v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> : 5.18v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> : 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> : 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> : 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP1V2_CPU_DDR</SIGNAL> : 1.18v
<SIGNAL>PPDDR3_S3_REG</SIGNAL> : 1.18v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL> : 0v
<SIGNAL>PPVTT_DDR_S3</SIGNAL> : 0.6v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> : 1.05v
I don't know why when I try to measure ppvcc, the board kind of go cold, doesnt produce heat from the cpu anymore

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
If mouse gets light if disconnect/reconnect with boad started, PROBABLY exists USB activity.
To CONFIRM 100%, use an OSX pendrive with Link LED; if flashes, that is.

Check if pins 28-30/J8300 get 5V in the first seconds.
Voltage should appear even without LCD; but will drop after few seconds.
Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
yeah i have a good known assembly, but there's no 5v there in the first second..
can I flash some light at the apple logo for retina lcd ?
if there is a green capslock, does it mean the board absoulutely turning on ?, if it is, I should be checkoing for no display right now..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
Put DMM probe on L8300, power on the board and wait 10s.
If no voltage appear at all, check in same mode for pin 2/<CHIP>U8300</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
i got no voltage L8300
i got 4.5v at pin 2/ <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>

I tried external video, and it work, got an apple logo

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, with over sensitive trackpad
threads.message:
"i got 4.5v at pin 2/ <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>"
So <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> is enabled.
Check if gets <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> and all surrounded components.
If all good, change it.
Be sure no short on pin 5.
